docs.summary: Backend events that are fired from Wix blog.
description: Backend events are fired in your site's backend when certain changes occur in your site's blog.
You can write event handlers that react to these backend events. Event handler functions
receive data that corresponds to the backend event that has occurred. Use event handlers
to create custom responses to the backend events.
Backend events are **not** fired when previewing your site.
To add an event handler, add an **events.js** file to the **Backend** section
of your site if one does not already exist. All event handler functions for your
site are defined in this file.
To observe if a specific event was consumed by the handler code and test the integration completely, please go to
**Developer Tools->Logs->View site events** from a dashboard of the site (see
[Velo: Viewing Live Site Events](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-viewing-live-site-monitoring-events)
for more).
Event handler functions are defined using the following pattern:
```javascript
export function <wixAppName>_<eventName>(event) { }
For example, an event handler that handles the creation of a post looks
like this:
```javascript
export function wixBlog_onPostCreated(event) { }

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the category that was created.

docs.summary: A backend event that fires when a category is created.
description: The `onCategoryCreated()` event handler runs when a category is created.
The received `CreatedCategory` object contains information about the new category that was created.
> **Note:** Backend events are **not** fired when previewing your site.

docs.summary: An object representing Category.

members.name: label
members.doc: Category label. Displayed in the categories menu.

members.name: postCount
members.doc: Number of posts in the category.

members.name: rank
members.doc: Category position in sequence. `-1` if no rank is defined.

members.name: translationId
members.doc:
ID of the category's translations. All translations of a single category will share
the same `translationId`.

Whether this event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation
application (e.g., GDPR).

docs.summary: An object representing Image details.
An object representing liked post.

members.name: memberId
members.doc:
Member ID of person who liked a post (returned if the member was logged in when liking
the post)

members.name: anonymousVisitorId
members.doc: Visitor ID if person that liked the post is not logged in

docs.summary: An object representing the Wix event location.

members.name: name
members.doc: Location name.  Maximum allowed characters is 50.

members.name: address
members.doc: Single line address representation of the location.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Type of location.
 One of:

 + `"VENUE"`: Event is hosted in the venue.
 + `"ONLINE"`: Event is hosted online.

docs.summary: An object representing an event location's coordinates.
An object representing Post metrics.

members.name: views
members.doc:
Total number of post views.
 // * @memberof wix-blog-backend

docs.summary: An object representing Post URL.

members.name: base
members.doc:
The base URL. For premium sites, this will be the domain. For free sites, this would be site
URL (e.g mysite.wixsite.com/mysite)

members.name: path
members.doc:
The path to that page - e.g /product-page/a-product
 // * @memberof wix-blog-backend

docs.summary: An object representing Post.

members.name: excerpt
members.doc:
Post excerpt. Can be selected by site owner or extracted from the content text's first
characters.

members.name: contentText
members.doc: The post content in plain text.

members.name: firstPublishedDate
members.doc: Date the post was first published.

members.name: lastPublishedDate
members.doc: Date the post was last published.

members.name: featured
members.doc: Whether the post is marked as featured. Allows for filtering posts by featured only.

members.name: pinned
members.doc: Whether the post is pinned. Places the post at the top of the post list.

members.name: categoryIds
members.doc: IDs of categories this post belongs to.

members.name: hashtags
members.doc: Hashtags in the post's content text.

members.name: commentingEnabled
members.doc: Whether commenting on the post is enabled.

members.name: heroImage
members.doc: Hero image placed at the top of the blog page.

members.name: tagIds
members.doc: IDs of tags the post is tagged with.

members.name: pricingPlans
members.doc: IDs of the pricing plans. Deprecated on '2020-10-02' please use pricing_plan_ids instead

members.name: relatedPostIds
members.doc: IDs of posts that are related to this post.

members.name: translationId
members.doc: ID of the translations of this post.

members.name: language
members.doc: Language the post is written in.

docs.summary: An object representing an event's schedule configuration.

members.name: scheduleTbd
members.doc:
Whether the event's schedule is to be determined later.

 If an event's time is not yet decided, the TBD message is displayed instead of the
 start date and end date.

 When `scheduleTbd` is `true`, `startDate`, `endDate`, and `timeZoneId` are not required.

members.name: timeZoneId
members.doc: ID of the time zone for the Wix event in [tz database format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tz_database), such as `EST`, or `America/Los_Angeles`. Optional for TBD events.

docs.summary: An object representing SEO data.
An object representing SEO general settings.

members.name: preventAutoRedirect
members.doc:
disable auto creation of 301 redirects on slug changes (enabled by default).
 // * @memberof wix-blog-backend

docs.summary: An object representing SEO tags information.

members.name: props
members.doc: SEO tag attributes/properties (name, content, rel, href).

members.name: children
members.doc: Tag inner content e.g. `<title> inner content </title>`.

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether the tag is a custom tag.

members.name: disabled
members.doc:
Whether the tag is disabled.
 // * @memberof wix-blog-backend
